Description: CareCore settled allegations that it authorized medical diagnostic procedures paid for with Medicare and Medicaid funds over a period of at least eight years without properly assessing whether the procedures were necessary or reasonable.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Southern District of New York
Labor Department Wage and Hour Division

Description: CareCore agreed in principle to pay $18 million to resolve multistate litigiation alleging that it auto-approved hundreds of radiology service requests on a daily basis, deeming them reasonable and medically necessary, even though there had been no evaluation of those cases by appropriate medical personnel. This was part of a larger $54 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-carecore-national-llc
failure to pay out-of-state business registration fee

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
